name: Rancho Cortez

reviews.text: After weeks of indecision, we selected Rancho Cortez (from many other ranches) to bring our middle son for his 6th birthday. I, being used to enjoying luxury at its finest, was hesitate on the entire experience but, afterall it isn't always about me when you have four children! My husband was certain this was the place for us and boy was he RIGHT!! We all had the time of our life. It was rustic as you would want and expect but certainly comfortable and clean. The entire staff has to be thanked for their hospitality and sharing of 'life on the range'. Larry was a most entertaining host. Our two oldest loved the trail rides and searching for arrow heads. Our 18 month old twins even had plenty of ground to explore. I can assure all, this will not be our last visit to Rancho Cortez!
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.text: For a bunch of City Slickers from Philadelphia, PA, we enjoyed ourselves so much we are planning a longer stay next year because we only spent the day on the ranch. The establishment is owner/operated - you will get the "real deal" from Larry Cortez (the owner). If you are concerned for younger children's safety on horseback, then Larry will ensure a teaching segment in the arena is conducted. We did this and it was worth every penny to watch our 9, 11 & 13 year olds learn equestrian knowledge, skills & abilities. My hunch is you will not want to leave the ranch. Last year, our vacation was to swim with dolphins & the kids loved it, but they said Rancho Cortez was better!
reviews.title: A friendly experience in a beautiful place to make family memories to last a lifetime!
Amazing cowgirl experience
reviews.text: Our visit at Rancho Cortez was the best thing we did during our 3 week roadtrip in the south. The two cool cowboys Larry and Rusty took the best care of us and gave us more than value for our money.

We mainly focused on lots of horseback-riding, which was amazing as well as sitting in the hot tub under a clear sky full of stars in the evening. Everybody is super friendly and the food is great. If you want an excellent outdoor/ranch experience go to Rancho Cortez-its so much fun.I can only give my full recommendation.
reviews.title: We love Rancho Cortez!
A fantastic cultural experience for international students!
reviews.text: //Rikke, Denmark
The Fitness Ranch is different from the Dude Ranch which is different from Warrior Boot Camp. That's the first thing.
reviews.title: Warrior Boot Camp Rocks!

reviews.text: For me, the idea of a Warrior Boot Camp was intriguing, and I was interested in the challenge and to see if I would still be standing at the end. The experience far exceeded my expectations in all aspects: service, food, exercise program, personalities, and the warmth of the other guests.
reviews.title: Beyond my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Notice that I do not mention lodging, Internet, or cell phone service. First, please understand that the Warrior Boot Camp lodging was the bunkhouse, not the cabins. I knew and accepted this going in, and it was as advertised: a basic, shared space that functioned well, was given more than adequate attention by the housekeeping staff each day, and served its purpose: sleep! I wasn't IN the bunkhouse very often.
reviews.title: A fun day in the sun

reviews.text: Internet was available only in the Fitness Lounge, and it was slow. Cell service required a walk up the hill each day. But to my mind, all of this is a good thing, because I was so busy with the many different fitness opportunities available, including access to one-on-one sessions with a personal trainer.
reviews.title: A DUDE WEIGHT RANCH>>NOT!

reviews.text: I liked that there were choices, both with the food and the level of activity. Some people might perceive this as unstructured or without sufficient guidance, but in my view, they are wrong. The choices allowed for autonomy, the practice of new skills, and to apply my own level of motivation to the entire program.
reviews.title: Relaxing Thanksgiving Vacation!

reviews.text: We had a wonderful time! Trail rides were great, lots of activities for kids, and the nightly campfires were a hoot! We met new friends and didn't want to leave. Food was good and filling. All in all, a very good stay.
reviews.title: Blast for me and my 7yo son!

reviews.text: They camp was the first all horseback riding camp I found. It's the real deal and in a week i had learned how to barrel race, met new friends, and enjoyed a great experience. I can't wait to go back :)
reviews.title: CAMP IS A BLAST

reviews.text: I stayed at Rancho Cortez from the 14th to 21st of September, I stayed under the fittness programme, hoping to get in shape and get a kick start to weight loss. The programme included all meals prepared for you and snacks, and roughly 5+ hours of exercise offered every day.
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin!!
A Total Fitness Vacation in The Hill Country
reviews.text: From my arrival late in the evening, I was looked after by Cheryl the manager, and by Mary and Larry the owners, not to mention everybody else who was working hard behind the scenes. The primary memory that I take home from the week is that I felt relaxed the whole while I was there, I felt that you could come and go as you pleased as you would in your own home.

The food was well thought out, and surprisingly more than enough to sustain the activity levels needed for the fitness programme. In addition I also found a notable difference in how much better I felt from a digestion point of view, which showed that perhaps it is not "just me having a terrible stomach" it was in fact what I was putting into my body. Which in itself is a motivator to eat a healthier diet.
reviews.title: life does not get uch better than this

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read all the reviews here on TA before booking a quick, last minute, weekend trip out to Rancho Cortez.
reviews.title: Flashback to summer camp

reviews.text: My husband and I needed a get-away and were looking forward to getting some much needed rest and decompression time.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!!!

reviews.text: When we arrived, Rancho Cortez reminded me of the sleep-away summer camp I went to when I was a little kid. I was enamoured.
reviews.title: Simple life + all day fun= kids that doesn't want to go home!

reviews.text: We got there just barely too late to make the last afternoon trail-ride. The manager, Cheryl, was initially apologetic and then seemed somewhat baffled when we expressed no dismay and told her that we really just wanted to chill out.
reviews.title: Fantastic Family Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received a map of the grounds and keys to our room. The room was clean, but nothing special. It would be a wise investment for the owner, Larry, to invest in new mattresses, bed frames, and linens. We were thankful that we'd brought our own pillows and duvet. We were dismayed to find out that every time either of us moved, it set of a chain reaction in the bed springs that nearly bounced the other onto the floor. The whole thing was also tilted slightly...so I kept rolling into my husband and he kept rolling towards the floor. We wanted "closeness" but that was maybe too close! The room did have a nice set-up for families....with a seperate area with bunkbeds. A family of 5 or even 6 (if someone used the fouton) could fit nicely.
reviews.title: Amazing experience...would recommend to ALL

description: Dude and Guest Ranch in the scenic Texas Hill Country. Horseback riding, western entertainment, and family activities. Great lodging and meals in packages. Ride, Relax, Live your Dream at Rancho Cortez!
